column4: As long as there is a row containing the process, the process is running.
so if the process is suspended it will not show up at all with the ps command?
A suspended process is actually running, but doing nothing.
Too less information to answer your question.
so then how does one know whether a process is running in Linux?
I was told that this command 'ps' would show the required info?
It is running when ps returns at least one column.
You have two processes of "rsync" running. No one can tell you what they are actually doing atm.
I dunno why there would be two ... there should be one ... oh well .. :P
that command outputs "4" ... what is that about?
Then take a look at: ps -ef | grep rsync
That output is pretty clear :) Three processes were launched for your rsync... command, and one is the "grep" you issued :)
